newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia stocks rise led by cement producers.
newsitem.headline: Colombia stocks rise led by cement producers.

text.p: Colombian stocks edged up on Friday, led by gains in shares of cement manufacturers Cemento Argos and Cementos Caribe, and reinsurer Reaseguradora de Colombia.

Bogota's IBB price index gained 0.26 percent to 841.37 amid a heavier-than-average volume of 11.3 billion pesos. Medellin's IBOMED general price index rose 0.39 percent to 13,319.51 as shares worth 22 billion pesos changed hands.
Volume in Medellin was bloated by a 16 billion peso cross-deal in chocolate manufacturer Nacional de Chocolates, which held steady at 8,300 pesos a share.
In Bogota, Cemento Argos edged up 1.44 percent to 5,275 in trading of shares worth 2.9 billion pesos.
In Medellin, 1.2 billion pesos worth Cemento Argos shares changed hands, as the stock rose 0.96 to 5,250. Cementos Caribe gained 1.72 percent to 4,323 in trading of 3.3 billion pesos.

A Medellin broker said the cross-deal in Nacional de Chocolates probably involved shareholders in the company's parent, Sindicato Antioqueo, adjusting their portfolios in aniticpation of year-end tax breaks.
